title.rendered: India’s 1983 WC-winning team issues statement on wrestlers’ protest, says ‘Disturbed’

content.rendered:
The World Cup-winning Indian team from 1983 responded to the wrestlers’ strike with a statement. “We’re distressed & disturbed at…unseemly visuals of our champion wrestlers being manhandled,” the statement said.

Read Also: India beat Pakistan 2-1, break record for winning most Men’s Hockey Junior Asia Cup titles

We’re also very concerned about their plans to throw hard-won medals into the Ganga. We admonish them not to make any hasty decisions and strongly hope that their complaints will be heeded, it continued.
